fields.headline: Jamie Lidell, Jim
fields.bodyText: Jim's lyrics could be taken as comments on Jamie Lidell's career to date: "I used to scream when a whisper would do," proclaims Another Day, while Out of My System reveals, "My doctor told me I was not a machine/ She told me I'd better let off some steam." Previously noted for experimental electronica - singing and scatting while feverishly mixing tracks on a turntable - Lidell has evidently decided that although it's nice to be cool, it would be even nicer to be famous outside his bleeding-edge scene. Jim remodels him into a standard bust-a-gut soul singer who purveys tunes so unrepentantly commercial that the album has been greeted with shock by the faithful. But it's not unappealing. Lidell sounds as though he's having fun on the bouncy Another Day and Little Bit of Feelgood, and his broiling intensity on Hurricane (to which Peaches adds backing vocals) is the vocal equivalent of a tropical storm.
